info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 02 at 10:11PM CDT until May 04 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Little Rock AR has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Arkansas... Spring River At Hardy affecting Sharp and Fulton Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Spring River At Hardy. * WHEN...From this evening to early Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Water is breaking out of the banks and flooding low lying areas along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 PM CDT Monday the stage was 8.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.0 feet tomorrow morning. At this time, this rise is expected to be brief, and the river could likely fall back below flood stage in less than 24 hours. However, this will all depend on how much rain falls upstream overnight, which could slow the fall. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecast 1 AM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Crest Time Date Spring River Hardy 10.0 8.1 Mon 9 PM 4.9 4.3 4.3 10.0 7 AM 5/03 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
